verses.verse: And Abimelech<WH40> the son<WH1121> of Jerubbaal<WH3378> went<WH3212> to Shechem<WH7927> unto his mother<WH517>'s brethren<WH251>, and spake<WH1696> with them<WH4940>, and with all the family of the house<WH1004> of his mother<WH517>'s father<WH1>, saying<WH559>,

Speak <WH1696>, I pray you<WH241>, in the ears of all the men<WH1167> of Shechem<WH7927>, Whether is better<WH2896> for you<WH1121>, that all the sons of Jerubbaal<WH3378>, who are threescore and ten<WH7657> persons<WH376>, rule<WH4910> over you<WH259>, or that one rule<WH4910> over you<WH2142>? remember also that I am your bone<WH6106> and your flesh<WH1320>.

And his mother<WH517>'s brethren<WH251> spake<WH1696> of him in the ears<WH241> of all the men<WH1167> of Shechem<WH7927> all these words<WH1697>: and their hearts<WH3820> inclined<WH5186> to follow<WH310> Abimelech<WH40>; for they said<WH559>, He is our brother<WH251>.

And they gave<WH5414> him threescore and ten<WH7657> pieces of silver<WH3701> out of the house<WH1004> of Baal-berith<WH1170>, wherewith Abimelech<WH40> hired<WH7936> vain<WH7386> and light<WH6348> fellows<WH582>, who followed<WH3212> him<WH310>.

And he went<WH935> unto his father<WH1>'s house<WH1004> at Ophrah<WH6084>, and slew<WH2026> his brethren<WH251> the sons<WH1121> of Jerubbaal<WH3378>, being threescore and ten<WH7657> persons<WH376>, upon one<WH259> stone<WH68>: but Jotham<WH3147> the youngest<WH6996> son<WH1121> of Jerubbaal<WH3378> was left<WH3498>; for he hid himself<WH2244>.

And all the men<WH1167> of Shechem<WH7927> assembled themselves together<WH622>, and all the house<WH1004> of Millo<WH4407>, and went<WH3212> and made<WH4427> Abimelech<WH40> king<WH4428>, by the oak<WH436> of the pillar<WH5324> that was in Shechem<WH7927>.

And when they told<WH5046> it to Jotham<WH3147>, he went<WH3212> and stood<WH5975> on the top<WH7218> of mount<WH2022> Gerizim<WH1630>, and lifted up<WH5375> his voice<WH6963>, and cried<WH7121>, and said<WH559> unto them<WH8085>, Hearken unto me<WH1167>, ye men of Shechem<WH7927>, that God<WH430> may hearken unto you<WH8085>.
The trees<WH6086> went forth<WH1980> on a time to anoint<WH4886> a king<WH4428> over them<WH559>; and they said unto the olive-tree<WH2132>, Reign thou over us<WH4427>.

But the olive-tree<WH2132> said<WH559> unto them<WH2308>, Should I leave my fatness<WH1880>, wherewith by me they honor<WH3513> God<WH430> and man<WH582>, and go<WH1980> to wave<WH5128> to and fro over the trees<WH6086>?
And the trees<WH6086> said<WH559> to the fig-tree<WH8384>, Come<WH3212> thou<WH4427>, and reign over us.
But the fig-tree<WH8384> said<WH559> unto them<WH2308>, Should I leave my sweetness<WH4987>, and my good<WH2896> fruit<WH8570>, and go<WH1980> to wave<WH5128> to and fro over the trees<WH6086>?
And the trees<WH6086> said<WH559> unto the vine<WH1612>, Come<WH3212> thou<WH4427>, and reign over us.

And the vine<WH1612> said<WH559> unto them<WH2308>, Should I leave my new wine<WH8492>, which cheereth<WH8055> God<WH430> and man<WH582>, and go<WH1980> to wave<WH5128> to and fro over the trees<WH6086>?
Then said<WH559> all the trees<WH6086> unto the bramble<WH329>, Come<WH3212> thou<WH4427>, and reign over us.

And the bramble<WH329> said<WH559> unto the trees<WH6086>, If in truth<WH571> ye anoint<WH4886> me king<WH4428> over you<WH935>, then come and take refuge<WH2620> in my shade<WH6738>; and if not<WH784>, let fire come out<WH3318> of the bramble<WH329>, and devour<WH398> the cedars<WH730> of Lebanon<WH3844>.

Now therefore<WH6213>, if ye have dealt truly<WH571> and uprightly<WH8549>, in that ye have made Abimelech<WH40> king<WH4427>, and if ye have dealt<WH6213> well<WH2896> with Jerubbaal<WH3378> and his house<WH1004>, and have done<WH6213> unto him according to the deserving<WH1576> of his hands<WH3027>
(for my father<WH1> fought<WH3898> for you<WH7993>, and adventured his life<WH5315>, <WH5048> and delivered<WH5337> you out of the hand<WH3027> of Midian<WH4080>:

and ye are risen up<WH6965> against my father<WH1>'s house<WH1004> this day<WH3117>, and have slain<WH2026> his sons<WH1121>, threescore and ten<WH7657> persons<WH376>, upon one<WH259> stone<WH68>, and have made Abimelech<WH40>, the son<WH1121> of his maid-servant<WH519>, king<WH4427> over the men<WH1167> of Shechem<WH7927>, because he is your brother<WH251>);

if ye then have dealt<WH6213> truly<WH571> and uprightly<WH8549> with Jerubbaal<WH3378> and with his house<WH1004> this day<WH3117>, then rejoice<WH8055> ye in Abimelech<WH40>, and let him also rejoice in you<WH8055>:

but if not<WH784>, let fire come out<WH3318> from Abimelech<WH40>, and devour<WH398> the men<WH1167> of Shechem<WH7927>, and the house<WH1004> of Millo<WH4407>; and let fire<WH784> come out<WH3318> from the men<WH1167> of Shechem<WH7927>, and from the house<WH1004> of Millo<WH4407>, and devour<WH398> Abimelech<WH40>.
And Jotham<WH3147> ran away<WH1272>, and fled<WH5127>, and went<WH3212> to Beer<WH876>, and dwelt<WH3427> there<WH6440>, for fear of Abimelech<WH40> his brother<WH251>.
And Abimelech<WH40> was prince<WH7786> over Israel<WH3478> three<WH7969> years<WH8141>.

And God<WH430> sent<WH7971> an evil<WH7451> spirit<WH7307> between Abimelech<WH40> and the men<WH1167> of Shechem<WH7927>; and the men<WH1167> of Shechem<WH7927> dealt treacherously<WH898> with Abimelech<WH40>:

that the violence<WH2555> done to the threescore and ten<WH7657> sons<WH1121> of Jerubbaal<WH3378> might come<WH935>, and that their blood<WH1818> might be laid<WH7760> upon Abimelech<WH40> their brother<WH251>, who slew<WH2026> them<WH1167>, and upon the men of Shechem<WH7927>, who strengthened<WH2388> his hands to slay<WH2026> his brethren<WH251>.

And the men<WH1167> of Shechem<WH7927> set<WH7760> liers-in<WH693>-wait for him on the tops<WH7218> of the mountains<WH2022>, and they robbed<WH1497> all that came<WH5674> along that way<WH1870> by them<WH5046>: and it was told Abimelech<WH40>.
And Gaal<WH1603> the son<WH1121> of Ebed<WH5651> came<WH935> with his brethren<WH251>, and went over<WH5674> to Shechem<WH7927>; and the men<WH1167> of Shechem<WH7927> put their trust in him<WH982>.

And they went out<WH3318> into the field<WH7704>, and gathered<WH1219> their vineyards<WH3754>, and trod<WH1869> the grapes<WH6213>, and held festival<WH1974>, and went<WH935> into the house<WH1004> of their god<WH430>, and did eat<WH398> and drink<WH8354>, and cursed<WH7043> Abimelech<WH40>.

And Gaal<WH1603> the son<WH1121> of Ebed<WH5651> said<WH559>, Who is Abimelech<WH40>, and who is Shechem<WH7927>, that we should serve<WH5647> him<WH1121>? is not he the son of Jerubbaal<WH3378>? and Zebul<WH2083> his officer<WH6496>? serve<WH5647> ye the men<WH582> of Hamor<WH2544> the father<WH1> of Shechem<WH7927>: but why should we serve him<WH5647>?

And would that this people<WH5971> were under<WH5414> my hand<WH3027>! then would I remove<WH5493> Abimelech<WH40>. And he said<WH559> to Abimelech<WH40>, Increase<WH7235> thine army<WH6635>, and come out<WH3318>.
And when Zebul<WH2083> the ruler<WH8269> of the city<WH5892> heard<WH8085> the words<WH1697> of Gaal<WH1603> the son<WH1121> of Ebed<WH5651>, his anger<WH639> was kindled<WH2734>.

And he sent<WH7971> messengers<WH4397> unto Abimelech<WH40> craftily<WH8649>, saying<WH559>, Behold<WH1603>, Gaal the son<WH1121> of Ebed<WH5651> and his brethren<WH251> are come<WH935> to Shechem<WH7927>; and<WH6696>, behold, they constrain the city to take part against thee<WH5892>.
Now therefore<WH6965>, up by night<WH3915>, thou and the people<WH5971> that are with thee<WH693>, and lie in wait in the field<WH7704>:

and it shall be<WH1242>, that in the morning, as soon as the sun<WH8121> is up<WH2224>, thou shalt rise early<WH7925>, and rush upon the city<WH5892>; and<WH5971>, behold, when he and the people that are with him come out<WH3318> against thee<WH3027>, then mayest thou do<WH6213> to them as thou<WH3027> shalt find occasion<WH4672>.
And Abimelech<WH40> rose up<WH6965>, and all the people<WH5971> that were with him<WH3915>, by night, and they laid wait<WH693> against Shechem<WH7927> in four<WH702> companies<WH7218>.

And Gaal<WH1603> the son<WH1121> of Ebed<WH5651> went out<WH3318>, and stood<WH5975> in the entrance<WH6607> of the gate<WH8179> of the city<WH5892>: and Abimelech<WH40> rose up<WH6965>, and the people<WH5971> that were with him<WH3993>, from the ambushment.

And when Gaal<WH1603> saw<WH7200> the people<WH5971>, he said<WH559> to Zebul<WH2083>, Behold<WH3381>, there come people<WH5971> down<WH3381> from the tops<WH7218> of the mountains<WH2022>. And Zebul<WH2083> said<WH559> unto him<WH7200>, Thou seest the shadow<WH6738> of the mountains<WH2022> as if they were men<WH582>.

And Gaal<WH1603> spake<WH1696> again<WH3254> and said<WH559>, See<WH3381>, there come people<WH5971> down<WH3381> by the middle<WH2872> of the land<WH776>, and one company<WH7218> cometh<WH935> by the way of<WH1870> the oak<WH436> of<WH1870> Meonenim<WH6049>.

Then said<WH559> Zebul<WH2083> unto him<WH645>, Where is now thy mouth<WH6310>, that thou saidst<WH559>, Who is Abimelech<WH40>, that we should serve<WH5647> him<WH5971>? is not this the people that thou hast despised<WH3988>? go out<WH3318> now<WH4994>, I pray<WH3898>, and fight with them.
And Gaal<WH1603> went out<WH3318> before<WH6440> the men<WH1167> of Shechem<WH7927>, and fought<WH3898> with Abimelech<WH40>.
And Abimelech<WH40> chased<WH7291> him<WH5127>, and he fled before<WH6440> him<WH5307>, and there fell many<WH7227> wounded<WH2491>, even unto the entrance<WH6607> of the gate<WH8179>.
And Abimelech<WH40> dwelt<WH3427> at Arumah<WH725>: and Zebul<WH2083> drove out<WH1644> Gaal<WH1603> and his brethren<WH251>, that they should not dwell<WH3427> in Shechem<WH7927>.
And it came to pass on the morrow<WH4283>, that the people<WH5971> went out<WH3318> into the field<WH7704>; and they told<WH5046> Abimelech<WH40>.

And he took<WH3947> the people<WH5971>, and divided<WH2673> them into three<WH7969> companies<WH7218>, and laid wait<WH693> in the field<WH7704>; and he looked<WH7200>, and<WH5971>, behold, the people came forth<WH3318> out of the city<WH5892>; And he rose up<WH6965> against them<WH5221>, and smote them.

And Abimelech<WH40>, and the companies<WH7218> that were with him<WH6584>, rushed forward, and stood<WH5975> in the entrance<WH6607> of the gate<WH8179> of the city<WH5892>: and the two<WH8147> companies<WH7218> rushed upon<WH6584> all that were in the field<WH7704>, and smote them<WH5221>.

And Abimelech<WH40> fought<WH3898> against the city<WH5892> all that day<WH3117>; and he took<WH3920> the city<WH5892>, and slew<WH2026> the people<WH5971> that were therein<WH5422>: and he beat down the city<WH5892>, and sowed<WH2232> it with salt<WH4417>.
And when all the men<WH1167> of the tower<WH4026> of Shechem<WH7927> heard<WH8085> thereof<WH935>, they entered into the stronghold<WH6877> of the house<WH1004> of<WH410> El-berith<WH1286>.
And it was told<WH5046> Abimelech<WH40> that all the men<WH1167> of the tower<WH4026> of Shechem<WH7927> were gathered together<WH6908>.

And Abimelech<WH40> gat him up<WH5927> to mount<WH2022> Zalmon<WH6756>, he and all the people<WH5971> that were with him<WH40>; and Abimelech took<WH3947> an axe<WH7134> in his hand<WH3027>, and cut down<WH3772> a bough<WH7754> from the trees<WH6086>, and took<WH5375> it up<WH7760>, and laid it on his shoulder<WH7926>: and he said<WH559> unto the people<WH5971> that were with him<WH7200>, What ye have seen me do<WH6213>, make haste<WH4116>, and do<WH6213> as I have done<WH3644>.

And all the people<WH5971> likewise cut down<WH3772> every man<WH376> his bough<WH7754>, and followed<WH3212> Abimelech<WH40>, and put<WH7760> them to the stronghold<WH6877>, and set<WH3341> the stronghold<WH6877> on fire<WH784> upon them<WH582>; so that all the men of the tower<WH4026> of Shechem<WH7927> died<WH4191> also<WH505>, about a thousand men<WH376> and women<WH802>.
Then went<WH3212> Abimelech<WH40> to Thebez<WH8405>, and encamped<WH2583> against Thebez<WH8405>, and took it<WH3920>.

But there was a strong<WH5797> tower<WH4026> within<WH8432> the city<WH5892>, and thither fled<WH5127> all the men<WH582> and women<WH802>, and all they<WH1167> of the city<WH5892>, and shut<WH5462> themselves in<WH5927>, and gat them up to the roof<WH1406> of the tower<WH4026>.
And Abimelech<WH40> came<WH935> unto the tower<WH4026>, and fought<WH3898> against it<WH5066>, and drew near unto the door<WH6607> of the tower<WH4026> to burn<WH8313> it with fire<WH784>.
And a certain<WH259> woman<WH802> cast<WH7993> an upper<WH6400> millstone<WH7393> upon Abimelech<WH40>'s head<WH7218>, and brake<WH7533> his skull<WH1538>.

Then he called<WH7121> hastily<WH4120> unto the young man<WH5288> his armorbearer<WH5375>, and said<WH559> unto him<WH8025>, Draw thy sword<WH2719>, and kill<WH4191> me<WH559>, that men say not of me<WH802>, A woman slew<WH2026> him<WH5288>. And his young man thrust him through<WH1856>, and he died<WH4191>.
And when the men<WH376> of Israel<WH3478> saw<WH7200> that Abimelech<WH40> was dead<WH4191>, they departed<WH3212> every man<WH376> unto his place<WH4725>.
